com.swopteam07.tablr.UI

Class Container<T extends Component>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Component
      • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Container<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Component>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DrawableContainer, TableHeader

    public abstract class Container<T extends Component>
extends Component
    A class representing a container that contains other components, when this component is drawn all it's children are also drawn.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Component

        mouseClickListeners, support

    • Constructor Detail

      • Container

        public Container(int x,
                 int y,
                 int height,
                 int width,
                 boolean visible,
                 Component parent)
        Create a new container with the given dimensions and visibility state.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the component relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        height - The height of the component.
        width - The width of the component.
        visible - The visibility state of the new component.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Effects:
      • The container component is initialized as a component with the given parameters.
            super(x, y, height, width, visible)
      • The elements of the children collection will be added to the children of this component.
            addChildren(children)

      • Container

        public Container(int x,
                 int y,
                 int height,
                 int width,
                 Component parent)
        Create a new visible container with the given dimensions and children.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the component relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        height - The height of the component.
        width - The width of the component.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Effect:
        The container component is initialized with the given parameters.
            this(x, y, height, width, visible, parent)

      • getNbChildren

        protected int getNbChildren()
        Return the number of children contained in this component.
        Returns:
        The number of children in this container.

      • getChildAt

        protected T getChildAt(int index)
        Get the child at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to get the child for.
        Returns:
        The child at the specified index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - | index < 0 || index >= getNbChildren()

      • addChild

        protected void addChild(T child)
        Add a new child to this component.
        Parameters:
        child - The child to add to this component.
        Postconditions:
      • The child will be added to the children of this component.
            new.hasAsChild(child)
      • The number of children is incremented by 1.
            new.getNbChildren() == getNbChildren() + 1

      • addChildren

        protected void addChildren(java.util.Collection<T> children)
        Add a collection of components to the children of this component.
        Parameters:
        children - The children to add.
        Postcondition:
        The elements of the children collection will be added to the children of this component.
            for I in 0..(children.size() + 1)
              new.hasAsChild(children.get(I))

      • hasAsChild

        protected boolean hasAsChild(T child)
        Check if this component contains the given child.
        Parameters:
        child - The child to check for.
        Returns:
        The given child is registered in this component.
            for some I in 0..(getNbChildren() - 1)
              getChildAt(I) == child

      • getChildren

        protected java.util.List<T> getChildren()
        Returns:
        All the children in this component.
            for I in 0..(getNbChildren() -1)
              result[I] == getChildAt(I)

      • setChildren

        protected void setChildren(java.util.Collection<T> children)
        Set the children of this component.
        Parameters:
        children - The new children of this component.
        Postconditions:
      • The new children of this component are equal to the given children.
            for each I in 0..(getNbChildren() - 1)
               children.get(I) == new.getChildAt(I)
      • The number of children is equal to the length of the given number of children.
            new.getNbChildren() == children.length()

      • unselect

        public void unselect()
        Ensure that the children of this container are not selected.
        Overrides:
        unselect in class Component
        Effect:
        Unselect each child.
            for each I in 0..(getNbChildren() + 1)
              getChildAt(I).unselect()

        Returns:

      • getSelectedComponent

        public Component getSelectedComponent()
        Returns:
        The deepest child that the user clicked in the last time a click was registered in this component.

      • handleClickEvent

        public void handleClickEvent(int id,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             int clickCount)
        Deal with a user click on the component.
        Overrides:
        handleClickEvent in class Component
        Parameters:
        id - The type of mouse event.
        x - The x coordinate of the mouse click.
        y - The y coordinate of the mouse click.
        clickCount - The number of times that was clicked.
        Effect:
        If a child exists that contains the point that was clicked delegate handling to that child.
            if (for some I in 0..(getNbChildren() + 1)
                  getChildAt(I).contains(x,y))
              getChildAt(I).handleClickEvent(x, y, clickCount)

      • handleKeyEvent

        public void handleKeyEvent(int id,
                           int keyCode,
                           char keyChar)
        Deal with a user pressing a key.
        Overrides:
        handleKeyEvent in class Component
        Parameters:
        id - The type of key event.
        keyCode - The number of key that was pressed.
        keyChar - The character that was typed.
        Effect:
        If the component is not selected delegate the handling to the appropriate child.
            if (! isSelected())
              for each I in 0..(getNbChildren() + 1)
                  getChildAt(I).handleKeyEvent(id, keyCode, keyChar)

      • updateContentWidthAndHeight

        protected void updateContentWidthAndHeight()
        Determine what the max x coordinate of the rightmost corners of the children and the max y coordinate of the bottom of the children are. This method should be called by resizable children when they're resized.

      • getContentWidth

        public final int getContentWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of the components in this container.

      • getContentHeight

        public final int getContentHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of the components in this container.

      • childIsSelected

        public boolean childIsSelected()
        Check if a child of this container is selected.
        Returns:
        True if any of the children of the container are selected.

        protected void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paint the container component and all it's children.
        Overrides:
        paint in class Component
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to paint on.
